subject: Productivity
title: Process Goals Versus Outcome Goals
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Process Goals Versus Outcome Goals.

hook.text: Olympic coach Tim Gallwey told tennis players to stop trying to win. Instead: watch the seams on the ball.

buildup.text: Process goals focus on the actions you control. Outcome goals focus on results you can't fully control.

discovery.text: Research shows process goals reduce anxiety and increase performance in competitive situations.

twist.text: Outcome goals still matter for motivation. The trick is to set outcomes quarterly and focus on process daily.

climax.text: Surgeon Atul Gawande applies this: checklists are process goals. Patient survival is the outcome.

punchline.text: Control the process. Let the outcome follow.

quiz.question: What advantage do process goals have over outcome goals?
options: They reduce anxiety and increase performance
They are easier to set up
They eliminate the need for outcomes
